snippet: In Japan’s largest antinuclear rally since the Fukushima disaster, between 75,000 and 170,000 protesters marched in Tokyo to urge the government to halt the restart of reactors.
abstract: Thousands of protesters gather in central Tokyo to urge the Japanese government to halt its restarting of the nation's nuclear reactors; polls suggest public opinion is divided over the future of nuclear power in Japan but a unilateral decision by Prime Min Yoshihiko Noda to start putting the reactors back into use has angered many Japanese and galvanized the antinuclear camp.
lead_paragraph: In Japan’s largest antinuclear rally since the Fukushima disaster, between 75,000 and 170,000 protesters marched in Tokyo to urge the government to halt the restart of reactors.

headline.seo: Thousands Gather in Tokyo to Protest Nuclear Restart
headline.main: Tokyo Rally Is Biggest Yet to Oppose Nuclear Plan
headline.print_headline: Tokyo Rally Is Biggest Yet To Oppose Nuclear Plan
